segments.text: I see the water spilling everywhere, and it’s making me so anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying that plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and she’s just ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while the kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are too busy with their cookies to care about the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be ruined if this keeps up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting soaked, and she’s not even looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is such a waste of water, and she doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a slow-motion disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
